snippet: The Transportation Department said the nation’s leading carriers had an on-time rate of 80.3 percent in August, better than the 77.7 percent a year earlier.
abstract: Transportation Department reports nation's biggest airlines had on-time flight arrival rate of 80.3 percent in August, up from 78.1 percent in July; says consumer complaints rose to 1,633 from 1,107 year ago.
lead_paragraph: The Transportation Department said the nation’s leading carriers had an on-time rate of 80.3 percent in August, better than the 77.7 percent a year earlier.

headline.print_headline: Airline Complaints Jump, but On-Time Records Improve
headline.main: Airline Complaints Jump, but On-Time Records Improve
